definition: to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy
variant of 繞|绕[rao4], to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex

sentences.english: He suggested that tangling fishing gear should be made a criminal offence.
sentences.chinese: 他提议，缠绕捕鱼器材应该算刑事犯罪。

sentences.english: Wrap the middle of the band around your foot.
sentences.chinese: 将治疗带的中部缠绕于足部。

sentences.english: The vine still clings to the moldering wall.
sentences.chinese: 藤萝依旧缠绕坍塌的墙垣。

sentences.english: Flowing water and green grass witness your lover 's endless prattle.
sentences.chinese: 流水缠绕，小草依依，都是你诉不尽的情话。

sentences.english: They made their way through a jungle woven with creepers and vines .
sentences.chinese: 他们穿过一个被攀援植物和藤蔓植物缠绕的丛林。

sentences.english: Recognize a feeling in the rain fly, a curtain of dreams around my breathing.
sentences.chinese: 认一脉情思在雨中飞扬，认一帘绮梦缠绕着心的呼吸。

sentences.english: When the coils come off the winding machine, they are fairly loose, and delicate.
sentences.chinese: 当线圈脱落的缠绕机，它们是相当松散的，而微妙的。

sentences.english: She tied a yellow ribbon round the oak tree.
sentences.chinese: 她把一条黄丝带缠绕在那棵橡树上。

sentences.english: "Your lives become intertwined and merged, " Dr. Neder says.
sentences.chinese: 你们的生活变得缠绕融合在一起。

sentences.english: Wrap a strap around sole of the foot and hold with straight arms.
sentences.chinese: 将瑜伽带缠绕在脚掌上，双臂伸直保持。

sentences.english: Garlands of fruit and leaves wind along the lower arches.
sentences.chinese: 水果和树叶的花环缠绕在低矮的拱门上。

sentences.english: He noticed the remains of a snake which was wound round the electric wire.
sentences.chinese: 他注意到一条缠绕在那根电线的蛇的遗迹。

sentences.english: The prone shadows with their outstretched arms clung to the feet of the hurrying light.
sentences.chinese: 竹影斑驳错落，挣扎著缠绕光阴匆忙的步履。

sentences.english: made by intertwining threads in a series of connected loops rather than by weaving.
sentences.chinese: 与编织相比是把线缠绕成一系列的连接的环。

sentences.english: The wind comes in, carries a magnetic field, which wraps around the ionosphere of the planet.
sentences.chinese: 太阳风过来时携带的磁场把行星的电离层缠绕住。

sentences.english: The article studies the theory of continued fractions and describes filament winding patterns.
sentences.chinese: 本文用连分数理论研究并解释纤维缠绕线型。

definition: to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy
to tangle up/to twist together/to wind
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
